newsitem.title: USA: TransAmerican sets price talk on junk deal-source.
newsitem.headline: TransAmerican sets price talk on junk deal-source.

text.p: TransAmerican Energy Corp has set the preliminary price talk on its two-part private placement of $1.53 billion (principal amount) in high-yield bonds expected for later this week, a market source said.

Price talk on the $425 million of senior secured notes due 2002 is 11 percent to 11-1/2 percent, the source said. Price talk on the $1.105 billion in senior secured discount notes due 2002 will be 1-1/2 points higher than the yield on the senior secured notes, the source said.
These price talk levels are preliminary and still subject to change, the market source said.
Jefferies & Co Inc, the sole underwriter of the offering, declined to comment.
Standard & Poor's has rated both tranches of the deal B-plus.

TransAmerican Energy is a holding company which holds a majority stake in two operating subsidiaries: TransTexas Gas Corp, an oil and gas exploration company; and TransAmerican Refining Corp, a refinery company.
TransAmerican Energy is indirectly owned by oil and gas mogul, John Stanley.
Proceeds from the offering will be used to finance a recapitalization of the operating subsidiaries, according to a statement by TransAmerican Energy.
